thread.title: Emergency warning issued as out-of-control bushfire burns in Melbourne - 9news.com.au
thread.title_full: Emergency warning issued as out-of-control bushfire burns in Melbourne - 9news.com.au

title: Emergency warning issued as out-of-control bushfire burns in Melbourne - 9news.com.au
text:
Emergency warning issued as out-of-control bushfire burns in Melbourne By 9NEWS 
Residents in Bulla, Diggers Rest and Calder Park have been advised to take immediate shelter indoors as a large bushfire burns north-west of the Melbourne CBD. 
Fire crews and aircraft are at the out-of-control blaze on Bulla-Diggers Rest Road, the Country Fire Authority (CFA) advised. 
An emergency warning has been issued for the Cooper Road area, with residents warned it is “too late to leave”. A large fire is burning in Diggers Rest, north-west Melbourne. (9NEWS) Twenty fire crews are battling the fire. (9NEWS) A Watch and Act alert has been issued for residents in the area. (9NEWS) 
“The safest option is to take shelter indoors immediately,” the CFA said. 
For more emergency advice visit the Victoria Emergency website 
The fire is burning in a southerly direction towards the Calder Freeway in Calder Park. 
One home has been damaged in the blaze, with many other homes in the area now under threat. 
Police have warned motorists to avoid Loeman's Road and Bulla-Diggers Rest Road. 
This is a developing news story. More information will be added as it comes to hand © Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
